meanings.sent1: The sky on a rainy day looked even drabber than usual.
meanings.sent2: The old building's paint was getting drabber with each passing year.
meanings.sent3: The party was so drabber than even the balloons seemed sad.
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew drabber as the sun set on her failed picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The classroom felt even drabber without any decorations.

meanings.definition: To make something dull or less colorful
meanings.sent1: She drabbered the painting by using only shades of gray.
meanings.sent2: The rain drabbered the vibrant flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally drabbered his outfit by spilling bleach on it.
meanings.sent4: The artist drabbered the mural to match the somber tone of the room.
meanings.sent5: The fog drabbered the once colorful landscape into a monochrome scene.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is dull or uninteresting
meanings.sent1: The meeting was full of drabbers who couldn't hold anyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a drabber in a room full of lively personalities.
meanings.sent3: The party was a gathering of drabbers who only talked about the weather.
meanings.sent4: He stood out in the crowd of drabbers with his colorful personality.
meanings.sent5: The book club was a mix of book lovers and drabbers who never finished a book.
